instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.ALLSYS_PWRGD: What is ALLSYS_PWRGD? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALLSYS_PWRGD, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.SMC_DELAYED: What is SMC_DELAYED? SMC_DELAYED Is an abbreviation of SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD which is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a pre-requisite for SYS_PWROK_R and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK..

threads.title: 3437 Bklt good, cpu warm, fan works. no displat
threads.message:
Have a 3437 that lights up logo, but doesnt display.  Did PRAM rest, nothing. Looks like it had minor liquid damage based upon palm rest, but it was cleaned.  
<SIGNAL>ALLSYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>-3.3
<SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED</SIGNAL>-3.4
L7310-1.75V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3VS_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3RTUSB</SIGNAL> 5.14

Any ideas?

I hate these ones.... typically end in NFNF

threads.title: 3437 Bklt good, cpu warm, fan works. no displat
